criteria.name: Third-Party Verifiability
criteria.keyQuestion: Can external parties independently verify audit trails?
criteria.description: Evaluates whether audit trails can be cryptographically verified by third parties without requiring access to internal systems.

scoringGuide.0: No external verification capability. Audit trails are internal-only or non-existent.
scoringGuide.1: Partial verification possible. Some logs exportable but no cryptographic proof.
scoringGuide.2: Full third-party verification. Cryptographic proofs (hash chains, signatures) enable independent verification.

evidenceExamples: Merkle tree root hashes published to immutable ledger
Ed25519 signed audit logs with public key distribution
Third-party verification API or export format

criteria.name: Tamper Evidence
criteria.description: Evaluates whether the system can detect if audit records have been altered, deleted, or reordered after creation.

scoringGuide.0: No tamper detection. Logs can be modified without detection.
scoringGuide.1: Basic tamper detection. Checksums or timestamps present but not cryptographically linked.
scoringGuide.2: Strong tamper evidence. Hash chains, Merkle trees, or blockchain anchoring detect any modification.

evidenceExamples: Periodic blockchain anchoring of Merkle roots

criteria.name: Sequence Fixation
criteria.description: Evaluates whether the temporal ordering of events is preserved and cannot be retroactively altered.

scoringGuide.0: No sequence guarantee. Events may be reordered or backdated.
scoringGuide.1: Timestamps present but not cryptographically fixed. Order depends on system clock integrity.
scoringGuide.2: Immutable sequence. UUIDv7 or similar provides cryptographically fixed ordering.

evidenceExamples: Monotonic sequence numbers with hash chain

criteria.name: Decision Provenance
criteria.keyQuestion: Can decision inputs and rationale be traced?
criteria.description: Evaluates whether the inputs, parameters, and reasoning behind AI decisions are recorded and traceable.

scoringGuide.0: No decision tracking. Outputs recorded but inputs/rationale unknown.
scoringGuide.1: Partial provenance. Some inputs logged but incomplete chain from input to output.
scoringGuide.2: Full provenance. Complete audit trail from inputs through processing to outputs with rationale.

evidenceExamples: Input data snapshots with decision output linking
Model version and parameter logging per decision

criteria.name: Responsibility Boundaries
criteria.keyQuestion: Are approvers and overriders for each action clear?
criteria.description: Evaluates whether human oversight actions, approvals, and overrides are clearly attributed and logged.

scoringGuide.0: No attribution. Actions occur without recorded human accountability.
scoringGuide.1: Partial attribution. Some actions attributed but gaps in override/approval logging.
scoringGuide.2: Full attribution. Every action has clear owner; all overrides logged with justification.

evidenceExamples: User ID and role attached to all override actions
Escalation and exception handling audit trail

criteria.name: Documentation Completeness
criteria.keyQuestion: Is technical documentation complete and current?
criteria.description: Evaluates whether system documentation meets regulatory requirements and is maintained up-to-date.

scoringGuide.0: No documentation or severely outdated (>12 months).
scoringGuide.1: Partial documentation. Key documents exist but gaps or outdated sections.
scoringGuide.2: Complete documentation. All required documents current and version-controlled.

evidenceExamples: Data flow diagrams with privacy annotations

criteria.name: Retention & Availability
criteria.keyQuestion: Is evidence retained and retrievable for required periods?
criteria.description: Evaluates whether audit data is retained for regulatory periods and can be retrieved when needed.

scoringGuide.0: No retention policy or <3 months retention.
scoringGuide.1: Partial compliance. Retention exists but retrieval untested or incomplete.
scoringGuide.2: Full compliance. 6+ month retention with verified retrieval capability.

evidenceExamples: Documented retention policy aligned to regulations

criteria.name: Time Synchronization
criteria.keyQuestion: Is system time synchronized with trusted sources?
criteria.description: Evaluates whether system clocks are synchronized to authoritative time sources with appropriate precision.

scoringGuide.0: No time synchronization. System clock may drift significantly.
scoringGuide.2: High-precision synchronization. PTP or equivalent with microsecond accuracy and drift monitoring.

criteria.name: Failure & Recovery Logging
criteria.keyQuestion: Are system failures and recoveries logged?
criteria.description: Evaluates whether system failures, errors, and recovery actions are comprehensively logged.

scoringGuide.0: No failure logging. Outages and errors not systematically recorded.
scoringGuide.1: Basic error logging. Major failures logged but recovery actions incomplete.
scoringGuide.2: Comprehensive logging. All failures, root causes, and recovery actions logged with timestamps.

criteria.name: Right to Erasure Compatibility
criteria.keyQuestion: Can GDPR erasure rights be supported while maintaining auditability?
criteria.description: Evaluates whether the system can honor data deletion requests while preserving audit trail integrity.

scoringGuide.0: No erasure capability, or erasure destroys audit integrity.
scoringGuide.1: Basic erasure. Data can be deleted but audit trail gaps result.
scoringGuide.2: Crypto-shredding or equivalent. Personal data erasable while audit integrity maintained.
